cyclone.name: LIDIA
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (no SSHS category yet)
cyclone.current_location: about 250 mi WSW of Manzanillo, Mexico and about 380 mi SSE of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest to north-northwest toward the southern tip of Baja California Sur, then forecast to track along the west coast of the peninsula and remain over the Pacific well south of California
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cabo San Lucas, Baja California Sur

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Puerto Cortes to Los Barriles; Tropical Storm Watch north of Los Barriles to San Evaristo, Baja California Sur
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Todos Santos to Los Barriles, Baja California Sur
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-west mainland Mexico (Michoacan, Colima, Jalisco, Nayarit) and the Baja California Sur coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are not expected at the port; occasional breezy conditions possible late week-end.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None â€“ only elevated surf and rip-currents expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate showers possible as outer moisture reaches Southern California late this weekend.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells creating higher surf and dangerous rip currents along the Southern California coast beginning late week-end.
